text: 8 dead in Tahoe avalanche; victims include Sugar Bowl ski team moms - San Francisco Chronicle
fullText: Eight people were killed in a Tahoe backcountry avalanche. Among the victims were mothers of Sugar Bowl youth team skiers, officials said.

text: As Israel takes steps to claim land in West Bank, U.S. stands by - The Washington Post
fullText: Despite Trump’s opposition to annexation, Israel has moved to expand control over the West Bank — to the condemnation of Britain and others at a U.N. Security Council meeting.

text: José María Balcázar becomes Peru’s eighth president in a decade - Associated Press News
fullText: José María Balcázar has become Peru's new interim president, replacing another interim leader who was removed over corruption allegations just four months into his term. Balcázar was elected late Wednesday with a majority in the 130-member legislature, defeat…

text: UNC Awaiting Henri Veesaar's Return to Practice and Games - On3
fullText: A team spokesman confirmed that UNC's seven-footer is still being held out of practice, more than a week after suffering the injury.

text: Quick hits: No. 8 Illini put on a show in 101-65 laugher over USC - 247Sports

text: 3 takeaways from BYU’s loss at No. 4 Arizona - Deseret News
fullText: The Cougars couldn’t topple No. 4 Arizona, with the shorthanded Wildcats scoring a 75-68 victory Wednesday night at McKale Center in Tucson.

text: Bowser declares Potomac sewage spill an emergency, seeks federal aid for cleanup - The Washington Post
fullText: The administration of D.C. Mayor Muriel E. Bowser hopes the move will free up federal funds to reimburse local authorities for repair and recovery costs.

text: Trump administration gives ICE broader powers to detain legal refugees, citing security concerns - CBS News
fullText: The Trump administration has given ICE the authority to detain refugees who entered the U.S. lawfully but don't have green cards yet, part of a bid to scrutinize the legal immigration system, according to a government memo obtained by CBS News.

text: Team USA Fans Cry Foul After Skier’s Historic Jump Doesn’t Win Gold - Mediaite
fullText: While many took to social media to call for an investigation, Forehand, 24, quickly shut down any speculation that he was robbed of the gold.

text: Trump meets with top Iran advisers as war threat grows - Axios

text: Boeing defense headquarters to return to St. Louis after leaving the area in 2017 - STLPR
fullText: Boeing announced on Wednesday that its security headquarters will return to the St. Louis region from Arlington, Virginia, after moving away in 2017.

text: Cardiologists Share 6 Surprising Lifestyle Habits That Boost Heart Health - AOL.com

text: Minnesota weather: 2 to 3 feet of snow on North Shore; significant accumulations in the Twin Cities - MPR News

text: Los Angeles-area state lawmakers call for Wasserman to step aside - Politico

text: Warner Sale’s Impact on Theaters Is Probed by Justice Department - Bloomberg.com
fullText: The US Justice Department has summoned some of the country’s largest theater chains to private conversations about the potential impact of a sale of Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., according to people familiar with the matter.

text: A startup called Germ becomes the first private messenger that launches directly from Bluesky's app - TechCrunch
fullText: Social network Bluesky now offers private messaging by integrating the startup Germ's E2E encrypted messenger natively in its app.

text: Highland High reports over a week of measles exposure as Utah reaches 300 cases - KSL News
fullText: Highland High students could have been exposed to measles for more than a week as an infectious student attended school, and the Utah outbreak has reached 300 infections.
